intro: Graphorkis capensis, commonly known as the Cape graphorkis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
